review_text:
The service, ambience, and food are all incredible here. I came by for dinner after hearing great reviews while visiting for a work trip. I did not have reservations but I was able to get a walk in spot in the patio. While we waited for our table we ordered drinks at the bar. I got the Mediterranean mule and it was refreshing and a great drink. We then ordered a few different items from the menu. It was restaurant week when I visited so we ordered one meal from there and one dish off the regular menu. To start we had the garlic hummus and it is the most delicious hummus I've ever had. The hummus was flavorful and the garlic just made it better. The house pita was warm and paired amazingly. We also had the Greek village salad and the veggies were super fresh and light and the feta was fantastic. For our mains we had the lamb and beef kabob which was super flavorful and the tzatziki was a great pairing. Off the regular menu we had the shrimp scampi, the crispy garlic on it was fantastic. We then had the sticky date cake which was a perfect ending to the evening.

Our server Joseph was beyond fantastic as well. He had great food recommendations and provided amazing service throughout the night.
Great space for a group meal! Beautiful setting and great appetizers and shareable food. The service isn't always on point but a great space for a working lunch or friend meal.

Ordered from this place on Uber Eats. what a joke. They advertised a pork belly with cherries. What i got was flabby pork belly, with a gross apple grapefruit mash - no cherries to be seen. The dish was disgusting. 27$ and the bait and switch with the cherries definitely made this a no-go for me. If they are dishonest about their dishes and send them to people as to go - they aren't ethical. Avoid at all costs.
It's good, overall. The eggplant dip is great. The date cake was also great and our server was nice and attentive. The ambiance is kind of mixed - nice ish and trendy looking but some misses.

Aba was fantastic! The ambience was sublime! Sat outside and enjoyed the evening view. Everyone who worked there with whom I came into contact was very nice. The hostess, the bartender and the server. Food was delicious! Salmon kebab, halibut, scallops, Brussels sprouts, sweet corn and pita bread. These were the tapas selections for the table. I left full and satisfied. I must return.

Aba is the kind of place that every millennial dreams of discovering. Talk about Instagramable!  Nestled in the heart of the city, it's a culinary oasis that perfectly captures the spirit of modern Austin dining. The food is a masterclass in flavor and presentation, with each dish telling its own story, making it clear that the chefs are not just cooking, but crafting experiences.

The service is top-tier. In an era where dining out is as much about the experience as the food, Aba's team nails it. They're attentive, knowledgeable, and have that uncanny ability to be there exactly when you need them, and fade into the background when you don't.

But let's talk about that ambiance. The expansive outside seating area is a game-changer. It's spacious yet intimate, allowing for both group gatherings and cozy date nights. The chill vibe it exudes, especially under the Austin sky, makes it a perfect spot to unwind, chat, and soak in the city's energy.

A heads up to my fellow millennials: a reservation is highly recommended. Aba is no longer Austin's best-kept secret, and for good reason. Whether you're looking for a place to brunch with friends, have a romantic dinner, or just enjoy some quality me-time with good food and vibes, Aba has got you covered. It's not just a restaurant; it's a mood.

Went to Aba for my 21st birthday on Monday around 7, wait was 45 minutes and completely worth it. The ambiance is amazing, the whole restaurant has such nice decor especially the outside area where we sat. We ordered the whipped feta, garlic hummus, falafel, crispy potatoes, lamb and beef kefta. And it was all delicious, the whipped feta was my favorite. The waiter also brought me desert for my birthday, overall a great experience and I can't wait to go back.
Extremely enchanting location and warm service. Delicious food! Always a treat to dine here... but need reservations!

long review short, i recommend!
must try the espresso martini if and only if you like rich coffee!!

food (5/5):
every time i go to popular places in austin, they always just taste the same. the healthy, basic, lack in flavor foods. especially brunch, everything is always so average, nothing special or unqiue about it. i love eating healthy, but it's just not worth going out and paying for it sometimes. my friend had suggested we go to aba. i just went for and i'm glad i đi because aba totally changed my mind. there actually is good food in austin! healthy mediterranean plus californian inspired brunch just hits different. i'm actually from dallas, but i would totallt drive back to austin again just to have a meal here.

drinks - ancient oak espresso martini + livin' easy

everywhere i go, i always order an espresso martini. i've only had decent drinks. i asked our server, jose, his opinion on it and he said, "there's bad espresso martinis and there's this." i went ahead and ordered it for myself and my friend ordered the livin' easy. when i first took a sip of the espresso martini, tell me why i became speechless. i never have ever had a decent espresso martini. i travel a lot and i go around order this drink in different states and restaurants. never have i had a drink like this. it's very rich and good quality. this is by far the best espresso i've ever had. the livin' easy was also good as well especially if you like vodka and strawberry lemonade! the drinks are strong and definitely worth the price.

appetizer - all of our favorite spreads

this dish included three spreads: whipped feta, charred eggplant, and classic hummus served with their house bread and gluten free crackers.
everything was spectacular, but our favorite was the charred eggplant spread and the house bread.

entrees - crispy pork belly + lamb and beef kefta

the crispy pork belly was very super tender not overly fatty and was served with roasted cherries which was very unique, but i enjoyed it whereas my friend didn't as much. the lamb and beef kefta served with rice, vegetables, and tazaki sauce. this dish was amazing. i actually hated lamb before i had it here. i've always hated the gamey smell and flavor, but this was ironically just perfect for me. the whole entire dish was perfect.

service (5/5):
our server was jose, he was nice and gave wise recommendations. our entrees did take a while, but it wasn't his fault. he gave us our space to talk and chat. nothing crazy, just standard, normal, nice service.

ambiance (5/5):
casual, yet earthy and calm. the vibes were so chill, the aesthetic, the area, the staff, i feel like it all ties together and compliments the food even more. it's a nice place to stop by for brunch especially when you're meeting up with someone!
This restaurant is overrated.  Service is great but food is subpar.  There are other restaurants in Austin that have tastier food with a better price.

We've been wanting to try Aba for a while and it didn't disappoint! Our server was super nice and suggested the crackers to go along with our spreads since the bread fills you up so much. Which by the way, the bread was so deliciously fried and went so well with the dips. Our favorite was the whipped feta - so airy and filling! We got two spreads plus the crispy potatoes and that was way too much since we had the lamb kebabs coming, so my advice is to not order too much at the beginning, or just split an entree since the spreads are the star at this restaurant. The sticky date cake was the perfect dessert at the end and I highly recommend!

This place is amazing! We went for lunch without reservations and had about a 30 minute wait on Labor Day. With no reservations we were seated outside in 101 degree weather. It was pretty hot and would have been better with some fans , but none the less the patio was beautiful. Being that it was busy, our server Connor was not very attentive. He did not ask our party about drinks and never came back with water refills. The food was absolutely amazing! We came with a group of friends and shared the whipped feta and hummus which I recommend. I was happy that they were serving the brunch menu on Monday for the holiday! Overall loved this place and would go back with a reservations for next time we are in Austin.
Amazing place. Food was so amazing, good quality and great taste. We tried a bunch of different things on the menu and enjoyed all of them.

Traveled to Austin for daughter's birthday dinner.
Five star food
Five star ambiance
10 star service!!!
Ask to be served by/seated at Justin's or Caius' tables.
All the shared plates we ate were superb: roasted garlic hummus w/ fresh pita, and rosemary rice crackers, watermelon tomato feta, crispy potatoes, salmon kebab, and roasted chicken thighs. Topped it off with something exceptional...honey cake. Worth every penny

Let me begin by saying that the interior design of Aba is beautiful, and it definitely gave me the romantic, jungle vibes much like Tulum. However, everything else was pretty horrible. We booked this reservation almost 2 months out and were seated at a great area outside. The service, though, was like 1/10. The restaurant was not as busy anymore (it was a later reservation) and our server barely checked on us after taking our orders.

We ordered a bunch of appetizers and drinks. The drinks came pretty quickly, the first appetizer came around 20 mins later which we didn't mind that's pretty standard. However, we waited an hour for the rest of our appetizers which never came.. and by the time it came (one of them was potato wedges), i kid you not, it was cold. At that point we saw the table next to us with the same server and they received all of their food even though they were seated wayyy after us.

Btw our bill was still very pricy even though we didnt get everything we ordered. It was over an hour so we requested them to just be boxed to-go bc that was just ridiculous. I think we were nice enough to just let it slide and pay up.

Btw we heated up the food when we got back and they were very dry and hard... so idk what was up with that.

I had very high expectations from Aba only to be disappointed like this lol

This had to be one of the best dining experiences I've had!! First of all, the restaurant design was stunning!! Pictures don't do it justice. Their patio seating was incredibly comfortable and the atmosphere was perfection. Every single dish was expertly curated and prepared; the flavor was unmatched! Justin was one of the best waiters I've ever had. His professionalism and attention to detail went above and beyond; he made my birthday dinner exceptional! Shout out to Caius too for giving us a special birthday treat! I would 100% recommend this restaurant to anyone and I will 100% be back!

This place has been highly recommended and a must try spot in Austin. And I definitely understand why now after dining here. The food was good, and I really liked the ambiance and drinks here. I highly recommend booking a reservation in advance because this place is really popular. We ordered the sneaky link and unplugged for drinks and both were delicious and refreshing for the hot Austin weather. For bites to eat we got the whipped feta, ahi tuna & watermelon, crispy pork belly, and garlic shrimp scampi. Everything was practically a home run except for the ahi watermelon, the ahi didn't taste very fresh and the best parts to this was the watermelon and cucumber. We should've ordered the watermelon feta salad instead.

The dishes here are consistently outstanding. If you didn't manage to secure a reservation two months in advance, don't be discouraged by the hour-long wait for a walk-in table - it's absolutely worth it!

Not kidding, one of the best meals I've had in Texas. Every single thing we ordered was absolutely incredible. All of the dips were mouth watering. The kebabs were juicy and flavorful. The brussel sprouts were top 3 I've ever had in my life. The restaurant itself is so beautiful and you feel like you're in a little Mediterranean paradise. We sat outside before it got too hot and we loved the atmosphere. Our server was attentive and sweet. This is 10/10 one of my favorite restaurants in Austin.

Atmosphere is what this is all about.

For temps above 90 degrees get the "breezeway" seating if you can! It is possibly, accidentally, the coolest and most comfortable spots to brunch outdoors in Austin.  Excellent people watching.
(Which is mostly what your money buys you here. )

I would avoid main patio at all cost during summer - can you imagine booking this 3 months out (it can be tough to get a reservation here) and then being roasted alive?

You get decent quality on food and food presentation.

Middle level service from our waitress but the AGM (who was in from the Miami location) was phenomenal.

The food was fine:
The way it was prepared was extremely well done. The spring veggie humus is a master class in technique. That being said I am not sure the additional hard work made the impact one would hope. The efforts may not be worth the outcome. The outcome is wonderful. Just not sure the added techniques added value beyond the fact that certain people can identify technique was applied.

If you want atmosphere this has it. You will feel healthy and full. Everything will be tasty and interesting.
